definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

pinyin: yan3 zhong1 ding1 , rou4 zhong1 ci4

sentences.english: She is a real eyesore in the group.
A famous because of who you water out of numerous thorn in the side of all of our men.
sentences.chinese: 阿水出了名的泡妞无数，是我们所有男人的眼中钉。

sentences.english: Professor Emerson Sillerton was a thorn in the side of Newport society.
sentences.chinese: 西勒顿教授是新港上流社会的眼中钉。

sentences.english: Cinderella is the thorn in her stepmother's flesh.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘是她后母的眼中钉肉中刺。

sentences.english: He aways treats me like enemy.
His friend has become a thorn in his side.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友已变成眼中钉肉中刺。

sentences.english: In fact, why not move that eyesore out now?
sentences.chinese: 实际上，为什么现在不搬出那个眼中钉？

sentences.english: He is a thorn in my side.
A thorn in the eye of the beast to the end.
sentences.chinese: 一直都是畜生的眼中钉。

sentences.english: He had been a burr under the saddle of the government in his time.
sentences.chinese: 在他那时代，他一直是当局的眼中钉，肉中刺。

definition: a thorn in one's eye/fig. a thorn in one's flesh
lit. calamity within one's bosom (idiom); major trouble hidden within
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
(of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
